cyclone.name: KAY
cyclone.current_location: about 260 mi south-southwest of Manzanillo, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn WNW tonight and then move NW–NNW, paralleling the Pacific coast of Mexico and Baja California and remaining offshore of Southern California late this week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Baja California Peninsula (near Punta Eugenia) if any landfall occurs

weather_observation.watch_coast: Loreto southward to Cabo San Lucas and Cabo San Lucas northward to Puerto San Andresito (southern Baja California)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South-west mainland Mexico coast and the entire Baja California Peninsula; large swells expected to propagate into Southern California waters late week
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤5%) of tropical-storm-force winds; breezy conditions possible Friday–Saturday
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along San Diego coast
weather_observation.rainfall: Moisture from Kay could bring 1–2 inches of rain to coastal Southern California late Friday into Saturday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large swells and dangerous rip currents beginning late Thursday and persisting through the weekend
